title: Sine and Cosine Graphs - cosine interval

content.question: ​The function <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses theta close parentheses equals cos theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following describes <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> on the interval from <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="theta equals 2 pi"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is decreasing, and the graph of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave down.

<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is decreasing, and the graph of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave up.

<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is increasing, and the graph of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave down.

<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is increasing, and the graph of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave up.

content.answer: <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is increasing, and the graph of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave down.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
